intro: Crotalaria chirindae, commonly known as the Chirinda crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with compound leaves and yellow flowers. It is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
